greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n which are not greater than the cubefree kernel of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The cubefree kernel of 56 = 7*2^3 is 28 = 7*2^2 and the divisors <= 28 of 56 are {1, 2, 4, 7, 8, 14, 28}, therefore a(56) = 7.
mathematica: Table[Function[k, DivisorSum[n, 1 &, # <= k &]]@ Apply[Times, FactorInteger[n] /. {p_, e_} /; p > 0 :> p^Min[e, 2]], {n, 102}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 18 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a007948(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = min(f[i, 2], 2)); factorback(f);
a(n) = my(cfk = a007948(n)); sumdiv(n, d, d<=cfk); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 14 2015
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 19 2002
